publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3339 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Thanks to Billy Connolly-That the Parliament joins with the people of Glasgow's East End in expressing profound thanks to Mr Billy Connolly for his magnificent effort in raising funds for the East End flood victims; is mindful of the time he gave up for free to play the SECC on three successive nights to packed audiences and how his gesture raised not only funds but also the hearts of people in Glasgow left with no possessions after devastating flooding, and salutes this international star as a true son of Glasgow, who returned to his roots at the moment intervention was most needed.
S1M-3339 Thanks to Billy Connolly (lodged on 3 September 2002) Mr David Davidson*, Paul Martin*
S1M-3339 Thanks to Billy Connolly (lodged on 3 September 2002) Mr John McAllion*, Brian Fitzpatrick*

S1M-3339 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Thanks to Billy Connolly-That the Parliament joins with the people of Glasgow's East End in expressing profound thanks to Mr Billy Connolly for his magnificent effort in raising funds for the East End flood victims; is mindful of the time he gave up for free to play the SECC on three successive nights to packed audiences and how his gesture raised not only funds but also the hearts of people in Glasgow left with no possessions after devastating flooding, and salutes this international star as a true son of Glasgow, who returned to his roots at the moment intervention was most needed. Supported by: Mr David Davidson, Paul Martin, Mr John McAllion, Brian Fitzpatrick
S1M-3339 Thanks to Billy Connolly (lodged on 3 September 2002) Helen Eadie*, Mr Michael McMahon*
S1M-3339 Thanks to Billy Connolly (lodged on 3 September 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3339 Thanks to Billy Connolly (lodged on 3 September 2002) Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-3339 Thanks to Billy Connolly (lodged on 3 September 2002) Robin Harper*
